dialog: I've been considering purchasing some delicious Chinese cuisine.
I savored some delicious chow mein at the Great Hall. It was truly scrumptious.
We can dine at the Great Hall.
I believe the fare at the Great Hall will be most enjoyable.

Mr. Brown, allow me to present you with this draft of the contract. Let us peruse the provisions and determine if we are in agreement on all of them. Afterwards, I shall create an original copy. Then, all that will be left to do is to complete the contract and affix our signatures.
That shall be acceptable.
The contract must be written in both Chinese and English, both of which shall hold equal weight.
Very well. If you'll excuse me, I would like to give it a thorough review. Hmm, you've done a splendid job. It is well-prepared.
My gratitude to you.
I suggest we only discuss the provisions and points where our opinions differ in order to conserve time.
A wise proposal.

Let us begin with Clause Two regarding the packing. Our standard practice is to ship our equipment in containers, which is both time-saving and cost-effective. However, your contract specifies the use of wooden cases. Hence, we request that the contract include the words 'containers are acceptable.'
Agreed.
Regarding the shipment, we are producing a full set of equipment for you, and it will not all be ready at once. Thus, would you permit us to make partial shipments?
I comprehend your stance.
I desire to purchase a black suit.
Of course. Would you prefer a double-breasted or single-breasted suit?
I would prefer a single-breasted suit.
What about this one? It's an elegant three-piece suit.
That appears quite striking. Do you have any neckties available?
